After paying his time in prison, Michael Vick has gotten a new endorsement. The Philadelphia Eagles' quarterback has signed a deal with Unequal Technologies. The CEO , Rob Vito, of Unequal Technologies said, We're real excited about it. Michael Vick is good people. He paid his dues. Barack Obama reached out to him. He deserves an opportunity. This is what makes America so great. He's moved forward. He's a whole other person. Unequal Technologies are the creators of sports pads. political operatives say he must do if he hopes to be re-elected. "The jury is still out on which way the Bill Clinton is going to go," said Greg Mueller , a Republican political strategist. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. "For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center," said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri. "This country is not ready for a pure progressive.
